title: Errors that don't exist
body: Umm. This is awkward but I'm getting some errors that say stuff that is totally untrue. Could someone give me a suggestion on how to fix it. I'm new to java so simple answers would be the best. Thanks.

comments.text: What are the error messages that "say stuff that is totally untrue"?
Ah the old conundrum.
the question title would be a good title for a rock song by the way
Or an album name. Could go nice together with "All Hope Is Gone" (Slipknot).
Javapocalypse

answers.body: This is the problem: You never finish the method - so you can't start the method. I strongly suspect that the first error message from the compiler was at the start of the method. Once you're source is that broken (trying to declare one method inside another) it shouldn't be a surprise that other error messages may seem strange. It's a good idea to: Compile often , and fix problems as soon as they occur. Then if you suddenly get a slew of errors, you know that it can only be due to what you've done very recently. A huge number of errors is usually due to something like this - look at the first error message, or at least where you start getting a lot of errors, and that can often find the problem. Getting the IDE to format your code can help you find missing braces too.

comments.text: If that doesn't fix it, you may want to read the following... Input is not how you input data in java, you use . If you already have a class handling input, I apologize.
Thanks. As always I never see these little errors :P

title: dc.js chart_ how to make the same chart appear twice (or multiple)
body:
I prepare a charts with dc.js. I need to show it on two place. I try to give same id for two div but only one chart is shown. Therefore currently I have to make two separate charts with same data, same everything. the one div with different id to show the second chart which is exact look of first one.
How do I avoid repetitive codes for the second chart.
I try chart2 = chart1; but it does not work.

answers.body: Probably the best way is to put all your initialization in a function and then call it once with each instance. Something like: Keep in mind that if you use the same dimension they will not filter each other, so you may want to do that part separately, depending on your app.

comments.text: Thanks Gordon. That's worked in a way I wanted. Same charts are shown in different views using JQuery (one on and the other off) and therefore filtering is no problem in my case.

title: Add a flag to send an email - cakephp
body:
To send an email to my provider, I should insert the -f flag before the e-mail address. That is, if I use this: I do not receive anything. 
I should add: "-f to@my_domain.com" 
Where should I add this flag?

comments.text: What's the flag for? What does it do? Where is it meant to be set on? the email client?
I do not know. This flag is required by the provider.
@user It's most probably a sendmail flag. http
How to use this flag in cakephp?
btw, please always mention your exact CakePHP version!
Sorry. The version is 2.4.6

answers.body: In case your server doesn't run in safe mode, you can define flags in the somewhat undocumented email config option, which is exclusive to http . Note that the flag is ment for defining the sender , not the recipient , so it should most likely be set to , not .

comments.text:
Excuse me for my superficiality. 
The cakePHP version is 2.4.6. 
This is the problem: my domain is www.dominio.com. 
The contact page, on the same domain, send an email to info@dominio.com. Under these conditions, the email never arrives. 
I have to put the -f flag before the address. 
The method you suggested causes this message: "An Internal Error Has Occurred." Can you help me? thanks
@user You'll have to check your logs ( ), they should contain the exact error message. If not, make sure that debug mode is enabled, logging is configured properly, and then try again.
@user Sorry, had a look at the wrong source, the exact error message isn't logged in 2.4.6 yet. Try the 2.5 beta, or temporarily remove the char from the command in .

I do not know what happens. If I insert the -f flag, the mail arrives, but I get the "Error 500". The log file tells me this: 2014-04-03 09:35:46 Error: [SocketException] Could not send email.
Request URL: /xxx/Customers/contact
Stack Trace: 0 lib/Cake/Network/Email/MailTransport.php(51): MailTransport->_mail('info@xxx...', 'Richiesta di: S...', 'xxx...', 'From: xxx@xx...', '-f info@xxx...') 1 /lib/Cake/Network/Email/CakeEmail.php(1122): MailTransport->send(Object(CakeEmail)) 2 /app/Controller/CustomersController.php(48): CakeEmail->send('xxx')

@user Have you done what I've suggested? Tested against 2.5.0, or temporarily removed the from the call in order to be able to see the exact error message (in case any is triggered)? You could also create a simple script that invokes with the given parameters to see if any error pops up and figure it out from there. There's nothing more I can tell you at this point, you have to do some debugging on your own.

title: Control spacing between bars in Highcharts grouped bar chart
body: I have two bar charts, drawn using highcharts library, on a single page. I need to maintain same width for bars and same spacing between bars in a group, across these charts. Size of container is different across the charts and fixed as per the UI layout. Snippet of plot options: I have tried various combinations and a jsfiddle link is here - http In the above link, though the bar width is same between the two charts, spacing between bars in a single group is not same. In fact, bars in chart1 hardly appear to be grouped. I have tried specifying different values of groupPadding, pointPadding and pointWidth but unable to achieve consistent spacing between bars across these charts. Please suggest if any other combination of options can help me achieve this. -Thanks

answers.body: Just to make it clear, you can use one of (not both): : forces Highcharts to draw bars with fixed width, + : calculates width of the bar according to these values and chart width/height Just think about this: how to set the same width of the bar for all charts when you have different number of bars? And the answer is to change charts' width according to number of columns. For example you have 4 bars? Chart height/width will be sum: 4 x 10px + some_padding. If you have 10 bars, when height/width will be: 10 x 10px + some_padding (the same as above).  I hope that's what you want to achieve.

comments.text: Thank you! Weird stuff happens when you try to specify all three.

title: Import can't my import entity product class
body:
I've added a new product type to my magento installation called "book". For this matter, i've created a module under local pool. Let's suppose this module is called MyNameSpace/Producttypes.
Now i want to import some "books" to the store. I've modified my config.xml so i have it like Further more, i've added my new class: MyNameSpace_Producttypes_Model_Import_Entity_Product_Type_Book But when i try to import i always get an "Invalid entity model" error. Debugging it, i've got an exception saying 
    Warning: include(Mage/Producttypes/Model/Import/Entity/Product/Type/Book.php): failed to open stream: No such file or directory  in [...]/lib/Varien/Autoload.php on line 93 So, the question: why is trying to find my class under "Mage" namespace instead of mine? Do I need something else in my config?

answers.body: Your class is called , but you have in your config XML.

comments.text: @user paste the rest of your config.xml, or at the very least your global -> models node. Also give us a full path to your class (case sensitive, so don't type it manually).
don't worry, i just solved it. i modified the xml a bit so now i have mynamespace_producttypes/import_entity_product_type_book
